program main

    implicit none

    character(len=1000) :: input_str

    integer :: n, MOD, num1, num2, uppercase, lowercase, i, temp, count_ones, next_digit, new_mod

    character(len=20) :: s, output_str

    integer, dimension(0:12) :: prev, current

    ! Read input

    read(*,'(A)') input_str

    n = len_trim(input_str)

    MOD = 1000000007

    ! First program's logic

    allocate(prev(0:12), current(0:12)) prev = 0

    prev(0) = 1

    integer :: base =1

    do i = 0, n-1

        character(len=1) :: current_char

        current_char = input_str(n -i: n -i)

        current = 0

        if (current_char == '?') then

            do pre =0,12

                if (prev(pre) ==0) cycle

                do next_digit =0,9

                    new_mod = mod(base * next_digit + pre, 13)

                    current(new_mod) = current(new_mod) + prev(pre)

                    current(new_mod) = mod(current(new_mod), MOD)

                end do

            end do

        else

            next_digit = ichar(current_char) - ichar('0')

            do pre =0,12

                if (prev(pre) ==0) cycle

                new_mod = mod(base * next_digit + pre, 13)

                current(new_mod) = current(new_mod) + prev(pre)

                current(new_mod) = mod(current(new_mod), MOD)

            end do

        end if

        prev = current

        base = mod(base *10, 13)

    end do

    num1 = prev(5)

    ! Second program's logic

    temp = num1

    count_ones =0

    do while (temp >0)

        count_ones = count_ones + mod(temp,2)

        temp = temp /2

    end do

    num2 = count_ones

    ! Third program's logic

    write(s, '(I0)') num2

    s = adjustl(s)  ! remove leading spaces

    uppercase =0

    lowercase =0

    do i=1, len_trim(s)

        character(len=1) :: c = s(i:i) if (c >= 'A' .and. c <= 'Z') then

            uppercase = uppercase +1

        else if (c >= 'a' .and. c <= 'z') then

            lowercase = lowercase +1

        end if

    end do

    if (uppercase > lowercase) then

        output_str = uppercase(s)

    else if (lowercase > uppercase) then

        output_str = lowercase(s)

    else

        output_str = lowercase(s)

    end if

    print *, trim(output_str)

contains

    function uppercase(s) result(res)

        character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

        character(len=len(s)) :: res

        integer :: i

        do i=1, len(s)

            character :: c = s(i:i) if (c >= 'a' .and. c < = 'z') then

                res(i:i) = achar(ichar(c) - 32)

            else

                res(i:i) = c

            end if

        end do

    end function

    function lowercase(s) result(res)

        character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

        character(len=len(s)) :: res

        integer :: i

        do i=1, len(s)

            character :: c = s(i:i) if (c >= 'A' .and. c < = 'Z') then

                res(i:i) = achar(ichar(c) + 32)

            else

                res(i:i) = c

            end if

        end do

    end function

end program

Then, convert num2 to a string. Then process the third part. Finally, print the result. Now, code outline:

program main

    implicit none

    character(len=1000) :: input_str

    integer :: n, MOD, num1, num2, uppercase, lowercase, i, temp, count_ones

    character(len=20) :: s, output_str

    integer, dimension(0:12) :: prev, current

    ! Read input

    read(*,'(A)') input_str

    n = len_trim(input_str)

    MOD = 1000000007

    ! First program's logic

    allocate(prev(0:12), current(0:12)) prev = 0

    prev(0) = 1

    integer :: base =1

    do i = 0, n-1

        character(len=1) :: current_char

        current_char = input_str(n -i: n -i)

        current = 0

        if (current_char == '?') then

            do pre =0,12

                if (prev(pre) ==0) cycle

                do next_digit =0,9

                    new_mod = mod(base * next_digit + pre, 13)

                    current(new_mod) = current(new_mod) + prev(pre)

                    current(new_mod) = mod(current(new_mod), MOD)

                end do

            end do

        else

            next_digit = ichar(current_char) - ichar('0')

            do pre =0,12

                if (prev(pre) ==0) cycle

                new_mod = mod(base * next_digit + pre, 13)

                current(new_mod) = current(new_mod) + prev(pre)

                current(new_mod) = mod(current(new_mod), MOD)

            end do

        end if

        prev = current

        base = mod(base *10, 13)

    end do

    num1 = prev(5)

    ! Second program's logic

    temp = num1

    count_ones =0

    do while (temp >0)

        count_ones = count_ones + mod(temp,2)

        temp = temp /2

    end do

    num2 = count_ones

    ! Third program's logic

    write(s, '(I0)') num2

    s = adjustl(s)  ! remove leading spaces

    uppercase =0

    lowercase =0

    do i=1, len_trim(s)

        character(len=1) :: c = s(i:i) if (c >= 'A' .and. c <= 'Z') then

            uppercase = uppercase +1

        else if (c >= 'a' .and. c <= 'z') then

            lowercase = lowercase +1

        end if

    end do

    if (uppercase > lowercase) then

        output_str = uppercase(s)

    else

        output_str = lowercase(s)

    end if

    print *, trim(output_str)

contains

    function uppercase(s) result(res)

        character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

        character(len=len(s)) :: res

        res = transfer(ichar(s) - 32, res)

    end function

    function lowercase(s) result(res)

        character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

        character(len=len(s)) :: res

        res = transfer(ichar(s) +32, res)

    end function

end program

function uppercase(s) result(res)

    character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

    character(len=len(s)) :: res

    integer :: i

    do i=1, len(s)

        character :: c = s(i:i) if (c >= 'a' .and. c <= 'z') then

            res(i:i) = achar(ichar(c) -32)

        else

            res(i:i) = c

        end if

    end do

end function

Similarly for lowercase:

function lowercase(s) result(res)

    character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

    character(len=len(s)) :: res

    integer :: i

    do i=1, len(s)

        character :: c = s(i:i) if (c >= 'A' .and. c < = 'Z') then

            res(i:i) = achar(ichar(c) +32)

        else

            res(i:i) = c

        end if

    end do

end function
